thread.title: How Chiefs rookie cost a Vikings player $100,000
thread.title_full: How Chiefs rookie cost a Vikings player $100,000

author: Andrew Joseph
title: How Chiefs rookie cost a Vikings player $100,000
text:
How Chiefs rookie cost a Vikings player $100,000 That's rough. Post to Facebook How Chiefs rookie cost a Vikings player $100,000 That's rough.  //usat.ly/2iYmy26   How Chiefs rookie cost a Vikings player $100,000 Andrew Joseph 7:50   
Kansas City Chiefs wide receiver Tyreek Hill (10) during an NFL football game against the San Diego Chargers Sunday, Jan. 1, 2017, in San Diego. (Photo: AP) 
The Minnesota Vikings' Marcus Sherels made $2 million in 2016, but a single punt return from Chiefs rookie Tyreek Hill denied Sherels an extra $100,000. 
According to ESPN's Field Yates, Sherels' contract has a $100,000 annual incentive bonus for leading the NFL in punt return average. Sherels was leading the league in that category heading into Sunday's game against the Bears. And he had a solid showing with two punt returns for 45 yards. 
Then Hill did this: — NFL (@NFL) January 1, 2017 
Sherels, having played in the earlier time slot, finished the season with a then-league leading 13.9 yards per punt return. The bonus was almost certainly his. Then, just a couple hours later, Hill took his lone punt return 95 yards for a touchdown, which jumped his average up to 15.2 yards per punt return. Tyreek Hill's TD Sunday cost Vikes DB Marcus Sherels $100k. Sherels had bonus for leading NFL in punt return avg. Hill's TD moved him ahead. — Field Yates (@FieldYates) January 3, 2017 
That's just a brutal way to lose $100,000. Read or Share this story: http://usat.ly/2iYmy26 Most Popular
